utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey! Wow, it is true what they say, pregnant bellies look like a drum.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ha-ha. No, it’s just I’m so pregnant that I—my guitar doesn’t fit anymore. So I thought ‘til I’m not, I’m just gonna play all my songs on this drum. It sounds really cool!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Listen. Listen. Smelly cat, smelly cat, what are they feeding you?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow, Pheebs! That sounds great!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know! I know, and I’ve only been playing for like an hour!

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Phoebe! Phoebe! Hi! Hi!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey! What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Umm, actually, I came down to ask you a big favour.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, well, don’t tell me you want to keep more of your stuff in my uterus.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: No. No. No. Okay, now, see, I wanna name the girl baby Leslie, and Frank wants to name one of the boy babies Frank JR. JR.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wouldn’t that be Frank the III?

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: Don’t get me started. Anyway, umm, since there are three babies and umm, we both got to put our names in, we would be truly honoured if you named the other boy baby.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! That’s so great! Oh! Oh! Cougar.

utterance.speaker: Alice
utterance.content: You think about it.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: I left a bra drying on the shower rod, you don’t think your son will think it’s yours and be horribly traumatised?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, if mommy can have a wife, daddy can have a bra.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Ohh, it’s time to go.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, no-no-no, see, that-that clock’s a little fast, uh, we have 17 minutes. Huh, what can we do in 17 minutes? Twice?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Well that’s ambitious.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, uh, you can ignore that.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: That’s Carol with your son!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uhh, believe me when he’s older, he’ll understand.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’ll be right there. Hello! Hello! Hey. Uhh, Emily, this is Carol and Susan.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Hey, it’s so nice to finally meet you!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Me too!

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Ohh, y’know, Susan’s gonna be shooting a commercial in London next week.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Oh yeah, I’m so excited, I’ve never been there.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh, well, I’ll show you around.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: That would be great! Also, uh, I was hoping to catch a show so if you can make any suggestions…

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh, there’s tonnes of terrific stuff—I’ll go with you!

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Ahh!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look at you two, bonding, making us late for the airport so…

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Are you all right?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Oh, he’s fine. He’s fine. It’s just that us getting along is difficult for him, because he doesn’t like me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh come on! That’s-that’s… true.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey! Do we have a baby name yet?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ugh! No! This is so hard! I went through this whole book and found nothing! I want a name that’s really like, y’know strong and confident, y’know? Like-like Exxon.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, it certainly worked for that Valdez kid.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ooh-ooh, Pheebs, you want a strong name? How about, The Hulk?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, I’m-I’m not sure about Hulk, but I like the idea of a name starting with "The."

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, want a good name, go with Joey. Joey’s your pal. Joey’s your buddy. "Where is everybody?" "Well, they’re hanging out with Joey."

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, y’know what, if you’re gonna do that, if you’re gonna name him Joey, you should name him Chandler. Oh, come on! Chandler’s funny, sophisticated, and he’s very loveable, once you get to know him.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh well, hey, Joey’s loveable too! But the thing about Joey is, if you need him, he’ll be there.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, Chandler will be there for you too. I mean, well, he might be a little late, but-but, he’ll be there. And he’ll bring you some cold soda, if want you need him for is that you’re really hot.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What do ya say? What do ya say?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I, I like the idea of naming him after someone I love, and Joey and Chandler are great names. But, all right, I don’t—maybe I’ll just name him The Hulk.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I knew I shouldn’t have mentioned it! That’s what I wanted to name my kid!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, Mon, if you were hoping to sleep with Joshua the first time tonight, which one of these would you want to be wearing.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y’know what? It really creeps me out choosing other people’s sex clothes.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Sorry. I’m so exited! I’ve been waiting for this for months! I got my hair coloured! I got new sheets! I’m making him a very fancy meal.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Um-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What am I making him by the way?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, you’re making him a frieze salad with goat cheese and pine nuts, wild nuts, wild rice, roast asparagus, and salmon au croup.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I thought I was making him filet mignon?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, you were, but you decided to make salmon because you had some left over at the restaurant. And then you realised if you bitched about it, then you would stop cooking, and you would have to make your famous baked potato and Diet Coke.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow, I really get crabby when I cook.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So uh, Emily called last night…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And now you’re giving me the message!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Turns out them Emily is just crazy about Susan. Yeah, they’re going to the theatre together! They’re going to dinner! They’re going horseback riding!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: God, Susan is so fun!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, this is just a little too familiar, okay? For like, for like six months before Carol and I spilt up, all I heard was: "My friend Susan is so smart. My friend Susan is so funny. My friend Susan is so great."

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You actually think that something can happen between Emily and Susan?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, they’re going to the gym together! Two women! Stretching! Y’know they-they take a steam together! Things get a little playful—didn’t you see Personal Best?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, but I’m gonna!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi! Hi! You’re crazy! Okay? This is Emily. Emily is straight.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: How do you know? I mean we thought Carol was straight before I married her!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I definitely. I don’t like the name Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What a weird way to kick me when I’m down.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No! No! I-I meant for the baby!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh. What’s wrong with Ross?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, it’s just y’know that something like this would never to like The Hulk, y’know…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Actually that-that’s not true, in The Incredible Hulk uh, No. 72, Dr. Bruce Banner found… Y’know, ugh, nevermind, my girlfriend’s a lesbian.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So, I decided I’m definitely going to go with either Joey or Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh! Oh-oh, you gotta pick Joey! I mean, name one famous person named Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Raymond Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Someone you didn’t make up!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, there are no famous Joey’s. Except for, huh, Joey Buttafucco.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, that guy really hurt us.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, how about a compromise then, okay? What if it’s like y’know, Chanoey?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, look, Joey! Come on, think about it, first of all, he’ll never be President. There’s never gonna be a President Joey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right look man, I didn’t want to bring this up, but Chandler, is the stupidest name I ever heard in my life! It’s not even a name; it’s barely even a word. Okay? It’s kinda like chandelier, but it’s not! All right? It’s a stupid, stupid non-name!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wow, you’re, you’re right. I have a horrible, horrible name.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m sorry man, I didn’t—I’m-I’m sorry. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So I guess it’s Joey then!

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: This is so nice. Thank you for doing this.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, please! Cooking soothes me. Ahh. So, dig in!

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Great! Oh, it all looks sooo good!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hmmm!

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh I know, my God, this is so—this rice is so—I am so good.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Behind you?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, I’m sorry. They used to live here; sometimes they migrate back over.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Is there ah, is there some way they can not be here. It’s just ah, farm birds really kinda freak me out!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, sure, okay. Okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, how did you do that?! Come on in.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All gone! So, farm birds, huh?

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s-it’s my only weird thing, I swear. And I-I-I would’ve told you about it, but I didn’t know they would be here.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: So, all right.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. So, can I serve you a little of—What? What? What?

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Nothing I uh, it’s just that I know that they’re still out there.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But, they’re across the hall! I mean that’s two doors away, it would take them a long time to peck their way back over here.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Okay, that’s-that’s not funny. Uhh.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, y’know, would you feel better if we went someplace else? I mean we could pack all this stuff up and y’know go to your apartment.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Oh, they’re working on this week, it’s a total mess. But uh, I’m staying at my parents’ house, we could go there.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Your parents’?

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Yeah, they’re out of town.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Yeah-yeah, it’s this huge place, and-and it’s got this gorgeous view of the park, and very, very romantic. What do you say?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah that works.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: They-they-they can smell fear.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Hey! How’s Ben?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I asked him if he wanted to eat, he said, "No." I asked him if he wanted to sleep, he said, "No." I asked him what he wanted to do, he said, "No." So, he’s sweeping.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Hey, Ben! Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So umm, any word from Susan?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Ooh, yeah! She said she’s having sooo much fun with Emily.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh-huh. Uh-huh. Uh, by the by, did it uh, did it ever occur to you that, I don’t know, maybe they might be having a little too much fun?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: What’s too much fun?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Y’know, the kind of fun, you and Susan had when we were married.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Oh my God, you are so paranoid!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Am I?!

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Am I?!

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: I can’t speak for Emily, but Susan is in a loving, committed relationship.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh-huh, Carol, so were we. All right, just-just imagine for a moment, Susan meets someone and-and they really hit it off. Y’know? Say-say they’re coming back from the theatre, and they-they stop at a pub for a couple of drinks, they’re laughing, y’know, someone innocently touches someone else… There’s electricity, it’s new. It’s exciting. Are you telling me there isn’t even the slightest possibility of something happening?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Maybe.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: OH MY GOD!! I didn’t really believe it until you just said it!!

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: …and even though none of the other kids believed me, I swear to God, that duck pushed me!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! This place is fabulous!

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, let me show you around. This is the uh, downstairs living room.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa, there’s two living rooms? God, growing up here, this place must’ve been a real babe magnet.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Yeah, well, it would’ve been, but uh, my parents just moved here.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, you should know, this place is a real babe magnet. Wanna make out?

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Hey, here’s an idea. Why don’t uh, I put the food in the fridge and we can eat it later?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That sounds like a plan. Umm, is there a place I can go freshen up?

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Oh yeah, yeah uh, it’s down the hall and uh, second door to your left.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Burgin
utterance.content: Oh, hi, darling!

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Mom, Dad, what are you guys doing here?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Burgin
utterance.content: Oh, well we cut the trip short.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Burgin
utterance.content: France sucks!

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Umm, this may be a little weird, but I-I-I got a date here.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Burgin
utterance.content: Oh, say no more!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Burgin
utterance.content: We’ll just grab some food and take it with us right upstairs, and we’ll be right out of you hair.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Oh, that-that would be great. So you didn’t even get to Italy?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Burgin
utterance.content: Yep, sucks!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi you!

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know, I can do more than cook.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Burgin
utterance.content: I like her. She sees smart.

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: Uhh, Rachel, my parents…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh! It’s so nice to meet you. Hello.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Burgin
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Burgin
utterance.content: Hello. Well, Joshua, that $500 was for groceries.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What? This-this, no, oh no, no-no-no, this is not—that’s-that’s not what it is. See, see, okay, I work in fashion, see and-and, this is a real dress actually. It’s-it’s, they’re-they’re wearing it in Milan, so part of my job is too wear the clothes, and then I see how people respond, and then I report back to my superiors at Bloomingdale’s, so… And obviously in uh, in-in this case, I am going to report back, "USA not ready."

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Burgin
utterance.content: Maybe in L.A?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes!

utterance.speaker: Joshua
utterance.content: There you go.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Burgin
utterance.content: So, have you kids eaten yet?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, we were going to do that after—I mean umm, next.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Burgin
utterance.content: Well, we’re starving, why don’t we all go get something to eat?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, well… Yeah, no use wasting this baby, just lyin’ around the house.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Burgin
utterance.content: So… We go eat.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Burgin
utterance.content: You’ll wear that. We’ll be eating, and of course, you’ll be wearing that.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dude, I am sorry about what I said!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, no, you’re right, it is a ridiculous name!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It’s not that bad.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes it is! From now on, I have no first name.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So, you’re just Bing?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I have no name.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right, so, what are we supposed to call you?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay uh, for now, temporarily, you can call me, Clint.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No way are you cool enough to pull of Clint.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, so what name am I cool enough to pull off?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, Gene.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It’s Clint. It’s Clint!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: See you later, Gene.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Bye, Gene.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It’s Clint! Clint!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What’s up with Gene?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So, you wore your nightie to dinner?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. And uh, the best part though, when the uh, waiter spilled water down my back, I jumped up, and my boob popped out.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, no!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, it’s all right. I got nice boobs.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, I just picked up a message from Emily, she and Susan are going to a poetry reading together!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So! Poetry? Susan’s gay! They’re being gay together!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Emily’s straight.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, wake up!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow, Carol really messed you up!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, she turned you into this-this-this untrusting, crazy, jealous, sycophant. All right, so I don’t know what sycophant means, but the rest is right.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, I don’t know what you’re talking about, I am not a crazy, jealous person.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: She’s totally right! When we were together, you got all freaked out about Mark and there was nothing going on.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This totally makes sense!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It does not!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, sure it does! In high school, you weren’t jealous at all even though all your girlfriends were cheating on you!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right, all right, so up until ‘92-93 he was very trusting, then ’94 hit, Carol left him and bamn! Paranoid city!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Absolutely! Absolutely!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: This is so much fun!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This is not fun!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Look, all we’re trying to say is, don’t let what happened with Carol ruin what you got with Emily.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. The ’92 Ross wouldn’t.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I still think I was right about that whole Mark thing.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What—yeah—what, y’know what? I hope Emily is a lesbian.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Drum roll.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. Okay. All right. Help! Am I a Mark, or a John?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nah, you’re not tall enough to be a Mark, but you might make a good Barney.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right look, am I serious, okay? Tomorrow at 3:30 I am going down to the courthouse.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You’re actually going through with this?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, look, this name has been holding me back my entire life. Okay, it’s probably why kids picked on me in school, and why I never do well with women… So, as of 4 o’clock tomorrow, I’m either gonna be Mark Johnson or John Markson.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You got problems because of you! Not your name! All right, this has got to stop! Chandler is a great name! In fact—yes, I’m, I’m sorry. I know you really wanted me to name the baby Joey, but eh, so, I’m-I’m, I’m gonna, I’m gonna name the baby Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, but you have to keep the name too!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You wanna hug it out?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yay!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yay!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yay—oh—yay! Okay, I gotta go tell Frank and Alice! Right now!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, uh…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Bye, Pheebs!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, bye!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ha! Ha! Ha!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ohh!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Nice luggage.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: I was gonna say…

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Hey! I missed you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I missed you too.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Thanks for everything, I had such a great time.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh, so did I.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No tongue.
